com.novell.ldapchai.provider
Interface ChaiProvider

All Known Subinterfaces:
ChaiProviderImplementor
All Known Implementing Classes:
JLDAPProviderImpl, JNDIProviderImpl
public interface ChaiProvider

ChaiProvider is the foundation interface for the LDAP Chai API. ChaiProvider provides methods to access an ldap directory.

Use the ChaiProviderFactory factory to obtain a ChaiProvider instance.

ChaiProviders can be used directly for raw ldap access. However, it is generally desirable to use the ChaiEntry wrappers instead. Using a ChaiProvider requires the caller to keep track of ldap distinguished names (DN) and be aware of context and other ldap concepts.

It is helpful to think of a ChaiProvider as a logical connection to the ldap server. Implementations may provide some type of pooling, or an instance of ChaiProvider may actually represent a single physical connection to the server.

ChaiProvider does not support any notion of asynchronous or non-blocking requests. Every method call will block until a result or error is returned from the server, or some other type of Exception occurs.

The underlying implementations of this interface may use a variety of strategies for actually reaching the ldap directory, including the standard JNDI interface javax.naming.directory , and Novell's JLDAP API. Different implementations may or may not provide support for server fail-over or other failure recovery.

ChaiProvider implementations are not guarenteed to be thread safe by LDAP Chai. Individual implementations may provide thread safety. Check with the implementation before sharing an ChaiProvider instance accross multiple threads. For a guaranteed thread safe ChaiProvider, use ChaiProviderFactory.synchronizedProvider(ChaiProvider).

To prevent leaks the close() method should be called when a ChaiProvider instance is no longer used. Once closed, any operation annotated with ChaiProviderImplementor.LdapOperation will throw an IllegalStateException.

Author:
Jason D. Rivard b
See Also:
ChaiEntry

Method Detail

close

void close()
Close the connection to ldap. All other operational methods (those that are marked with com.novell.ldapchai.provider.ChaiProviderImplementor.LdapOperation) should throw an exception if called after this method.

compareStringAttribute

boolean compareStringAttribute(String entryDN,
                               String attributeName,
                               String value)
                               throws ChaiOperationException,
                                      ChaiUnavailableException,
                                      IllegalStateException
Compares the value of a string to an ldap entry's specified attribute. Implementers of this method will actually perform an COMPARE operation, as opposed to doing a java .equals() style compare.

Parameters:
entryDN - A valid entryDN
attributeName - The attribute of the object DN to do the comparison to.
value - The value to compare against the value in the directory
Returns:
true if the value comparison is true, false otherwise
Throws:
ChaiOperationException - If an error is encountered during the operation
ChaiUnavailableException - If no directory servers are reachable
IllegalStateException - If the underlying connection is not in an available state
See Also:
ChaiEntry.compareStringAttribute(String, String)

readMultiByteAttribute

byte[][] readMultiByteAttribute(String entryDN,
                                String attribute)
                                throws ChaiOperationException,
                                       ChaiUnavailableException,
                                       IllegalStateException
Performs a read operation against the directory and returns the binary results. Useful only for ldap attributes using binary syntax type.

Parameters:
entryDN - A valid object
attribute - A valid attribute on the object.
Returns:
A byte array where the first dimension is each ldap value, and the second diminsion is the actual byte values.
Throws:
ChaiOperationException - If an error is encountered during the operation
ChaiUnavailableException - If no directory servers are reachable
IllegalStateException - If the underlying connection is not in an available state
See Also:
ChaiEntry.readMultiByteAttribute(String)

                                            IllegalStateException

Parameters:

attribute - A valid attribute on the object
Returns:

ChaiUnavailableException - If no directory servers are reachable
IllegalStateException - If the underlying connection is not in an available state

                           String attribute)
                           throws ChaiOperationException,

                                        Set<String> attributes)
                                        throws ChaiOperationException,
                                               ChaiUnavailableException,
                                               IllegalStateException
Read an array of specified attributes. If any of the attributes has multiple values, only the first value returned by the directory is returned.

Parameters:
entryDN - The full DN of the object to read
attributes - An array of valid attributes on the object.
Returns:
attributes A Map where the keys are the specifed attributes, and the value is a string containing the value or null if no value is found
Throws:
ChaiOperationException - If an error is encountered during the operation
ChaiUnavailableException - If no directory servers are reachable
IllegalStateException - If the underlying connection is not in an available state
See Also:

search

Map<String,Map<String,String>> search(String baseDN,
                                      SearchHelper searchHelper)
                                      throws ChaiOperationException,
                                             ChaiUnavailableException,
                                             IllegalStateException
Performs a search against the directory for the objects, given the specified basedn and SearchHelper. A subtree search is implied. Attribute values are returned according to the attributes specifed in the SearchHelper.

Parameters:
baseDN - A valid object DN for the top of the search, or an empty string if the whole ldap namespace is to be searched
searchHelper - A Chai searchHelper
Returns:
A Map containing strings of entryDNs as keys, and values of Properties objects. Within each properties object the key is a specified attribute name and its associated value.
Throws:
ChaiOperationException - If an error is encountered during the operation
ChaiUnavailableException - If no directory servers are reachable
IllegalStateException - If the underlying connection is not in an available state
See Also:
ChaiEntry.search(String)

search

Map<String,Map<String,String>> search(String baseDN,
                                      String filter,
                                      Set<String> attributes,
                                      ChaiProvider.SEARCH_SCOPE searchScope)
                                      throws ChaiOperationException,
                                             ChaiUnavailableException,
                                             IllegalStateException
Performs a search against the directory for the objects, given the specified baseDN and filter. Additionally, the specified attributes are returned for any matches. Only the a single value of each attribute is returned.

Parameters:
baseDN - A valid object DN for the top of the search, or an empty string if the whole ldap namespace is to be searched
filter - A valid ldap search filter
attributes - An array containing the desired attributes to be returned. Set to null for all attributes, set to an empty String[] for no attributes
searchScope - Scope of the search
Returns:
A Map containing strings of entryDNs as keys, and values of Map objects. Within each map object the key is a specified attribute name and its associated value.
Throws:
ChaiOperationException - If an error is encountered during the operation
ChaiUnavailableException - If no directory servers are reachable
IllegalStateException - If the underlying connection is not in an available state
See Also:
ChaiEntry.search(String)

searchMultiValues

Map<String,Map<String,List<String>>> searchMultiValues(String baseDN,
                                                       SearchHelper searchHelper)
                                                       throws ChaiUnavailableException,
                                                              ChaiOperationException
Perform a search where multiple values of an object are returned. Care should be taken to avoid very large search results, as the entire result set is held in memory before being returned to the caller.

Parameters:
baseDN - A valid entryDN
searchHelper - A Chai searchHelper
Returns:
A map containing Strings of DNs for keys, and a Map for values. The value map itself contains attribute name Strings as keys, and a List of values for each attribute.
Throws:
ChaiOperationException - If an error is encountered during the operation
ChaiUnavailableException - If no directory servers are reachable
IllegalStateException - If the underlying connection is not in an available state
See Also:
ChaiEntry.search(String)

searchMultiValues

Map<String,Map<String,List<String>>> searchMultiValues(String baseDN,
                                                       String filter,
                                                       Set<String> attributes,
                                                       ChaiProvider.SEARCH_SCOPE searchScope)
                                                       throws ChaiOperationException,
                                                              ChaiUnavailableException,
                                                              IllegalStateException
Perform a search where multiple values of an object are returned. Care should be taken to avoid very large search results, as the entire result set is held in memory before being returned to the caller.

Parameters:
baseDN - A valid entryDN
filter - Search filter
attributes - attribugtes to return. Null indicates all values, An empty array will return no values.
searchScope - The LDAP scope of the search
Returns:
A map containing Strings of DNs for keys, and a Map for values. The value map itself contains attribute name Strings as keys, and a List of values for each attribute.
Throws:
ChaiOperationException - If an error is encountered during the operation
ChaiUnavailableException - If no directory servers are reachable
IllegalStateException - If the underlying connection is not in an available state
See Also:
ChaiEntry.search(String)

getDirectoryVendor

ChaiProvider.DIRECTORY_VENDOR getDirectoryVendor()
                                                 throws ChaiUnavailableException
Discovers and returns the Chai API's interpretation of the vendor of the configured directory. ChaiProvider implementations will typically cache this value for the life of the instance.

Returns:
The Chai API's interpretation of the vendor of the configured directory.
Throws:
ChaiUnavailableException - If no directory servers are reachable
See Also:
ChaiUtility.determineDirectoryVendor(com.novell.ldapchai.ChaiEntry), ChaiSetting.DEFAULT_VENDOR

replaceBinaryAttribute

void replaceBinaryAttribute(String entryDN,
                            String attributeName,
                            byte[] oldValue,
                            byte[] newValue)
                            throws ChaiUnavailableException,
                                   ChaiOperationException
Replace binary value of the specified object's specified attribute.

Parameters:
entryDN - A valid entryDN
attributeName - A valid attribute of the entryDN
oldValue - A existing value to replace (the value must pre-exist in the directory)
newValue - New value to write to the directory
Throws:
ChaiOperationException - If an error is encountered during the operation
ChaiUnavailableException - If no directory servers are reachable
IllegalStateException - If the underlying connection is not in an available state

isConnected

boolean isConnected()
Indicates if the provider has a current, active connection to the ldap directory.

Returns:
true if the connection has a valid, active connection to the ldap directory.
